Job Title: 2024 University Recruiting - Regulatory Planning and Publishing Intern

Location: North Wales, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, General Business

Description:
Job Description

The Future Talent Program features internships that last up to 12 weeks and will include one or more projects. These opportunities can provide you with great development and a chance to see if we are the right company for your long-term goals.

Regulatory Planning and Publishing (RPP) is responsible for driving innovative quality planning, achieving publishing and delivery excellence, and ensuring compliant regulatory submissions to facilitate successful review by health authorities worldwide. RPP drives innovation through collaboration, and a commitment to quality and compliance in alignment with our Company's core values. The organization consists of Portfolio and Program Management (PPM) and Global Submission Publishing (GSP). Additionally, two supportive functions, Quality and Compliance Management (QCM) and Digital Innovation and Systems (DIS) provide support to all planning and publishing activities.

The intern position within Regulatory Planning and Publishing (RPP) would be involved with the supporting activities tied to submission delivery in both planning and publishing. Project activities may include but are not limited to support of process improvement initiatives, completion of supporting documentation, and creation of training material. The internship will incorporate overviews of the end-to-end submissions process and may include direct support of document/submission publishing. The intern will be applying critical thinking and creativity to contribute to innovation and efficiencies to lead and complete projects.

NOTE: This internship is available in Rahway, NJ or Upper Gwynedd, PA based on candidate preference. Candidate should indicate preferred location(s) when applying to this internship.

Required Experience And Skills

Candidate must be able to commit to full-time hybrid employment for 10 - 12 weeks beginning June 2024Candidates must have initiative, leadership, and ownership of deliverables with ability to work in high performance teamsCandidates must have excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills 

Preferred Experience And Skills

Candidates should be a self-starter, fast learner and able to multi-task and work in fast-paced environment with rapid priority shiftsCandidates should have proficiency in, Office 365 (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)Candidates should have project management or change management awarenessCandidates should be proficient working with Portable Document Format (PDF) files and familiar with PDF navigation using bookmarks and linksCandidates should have a capacity for learning advanced features in MS Word, Excel, Adobe Acrobat, Spotfire, and Power BICandidates should have a GPA of 3.0 or higher

Under New York City, Colorado State, Washington State, and California State law, the Company is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the salary range for this job. Final determinations with respect to salary will take into account a number of factors, which may include, but not be limited to the primary work location and the chosen candidate’s relevant skills, experience, and education.

Expected Salary Range

$39,600.00 - $105,500.00

Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. Please also note that, where permitted by applicable law, the Company reserves the right to require COVID-19 vaccinations for positions, such as in Global Employee Health, where the Company determines in its discretion that the nature of the role presents an increased risk of disease transmission.

U.S. Hybrid Work Model

Effective September 5, 2023, employees in office-based positions in the U.S. will be working a Hybrid work consisting of three total days on-site per week, generally Tuesday, Wednesday and either Monday or Thursday, although the specific days may vary by site or organization, with Friday designated as a remote-working day, unless business critical tasks require an on-site presence.
